newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel says troops kill guerrilla in Lebanon.
newsitem.headline: Israel says troops kill guerrilla in Lebanon.

text.p: Israeli troops have killed at least one Hizbollah guerrilla during an encounter in south Lebanon, the army said on Thursday.
It said the clash took place on Wednesday in the eastern sector of the army's self-declared security zone bordering northern Israel.
"At least one terrorist was killed in an encounter of an Israeli army force with a Hizbollah force," the army said. "There were no injuries to our forces."
On Monday, Israeli planes struck three times in Lebanon after Hizbollah fighters wounded four pro-Israeli militiamen and an Israeli soldier in an attack, security sources said.
Hizbollah, the Shi'ite Moslem "Party of God," regularly attacks Israeli troops to try to oust them from the south Lebanon zone.
Israel's peace talks with Lebanon and with Syria, the main power broker in Lebanon, have been deadlocked off and on and for more than a year since they began in 1991.
